art_movements.name: Prehistoric Art
art_movements.description: Simple, stylized forms often depicted in cave paintings or petroglyphs.
art_movements.period_description: The earliest known human artistic expressions, created long before the advent of writing systems.

art_movements.name: Ancient Egyptian Art
art_movements.description: Flat, profile views with bold, solid, and symbolic colors rather than realistic ones.
art_movements.period_description: Art from ancient Egypt, characterized by its stylized depiction of deities, pharaohs, and symbolic imagery.

art_movements.name: Classical Greek Art
art_movements.description: Idealized realism with perfect proportions and subtle shading to create a three-dimensional effect.
art_movements.period_description: Art from ancient Greece that set standards for beauty and proportion in Western art.

art_movements.name: Ancient Roman Art
art_movements.description: Realistic depictions, often in mosaics or frescoes, influenced by Greek art but with a focus on portraiture and historical scenes.
art_movements.period_description: Art from the Roman civilization, renowned for its architecture, sculpture, and decorative arts.

art_movements.name: Byzantine Art
art_movements.description: Highly stylized and often adorned with gold leaf, particularly in religious icons and mosaics.
art_movements.period_description: Art of the Eastern Roman (Byzantine) Empire, marked by religious themes and ornate decoration.

art_movements.name: Medieval Art
art_movements.description: Religious themes, flat colors, and stylized forms, commonly seen in illuminated manuscripts.
art_movements.period_description: Art from the Middle Ages in Europe, heavily influenced by Christianity and feudal society.

art_movements.name: Gothic Art
art_movements.description: Elongated forms frequently seen in architecture and stained glass windows.
art_movements.period_description: Late medieval art style noted for its pointed arches, ribbed vaults, and large windows.

art_movements.name: Renaissance
art_movements.description: Precise detail, accurate shading, and perfect perspective in paintings and sculptures.
art_movements.period_description: A revival of classical learning and values, emphasizing realism and human-focused themes.

art_movements.name: Mannerism
art_movements.description: Exaggerated, elegant styles with unusual colors or proportions.
art_movements.period_description: A style that emerged from the later years of the Italian High Renaissance, reacting against harmonious classicism.

art_movements.name: Baroque
art_movements.description: Dramatic lighting, rich colors, and dynamic compositions.
art_movements.period_description: An artistic style marked by exuberance, drama, and grandeur across sculpture, painting, architecture, and music.

art_movements.name: Rococo
art_movements.description: Ornate, playful style with pastel colors and curving forms.
art_movements.period_description: An 18th-century artistic movement characterized by lightness, elegance, and exuberant use of curving natural forms.

art_movements.name: Neoclassicism
art_movements.description: Idealized realism inspired by classical antiquity.
art_movements.period_description: A revival of styles and spirit from classical antiquity, inspired directly from the classical period.

art_movements.name: Romanticism
art_movements.description: Dreamy, idealized manner often set in natural settings with soft lighting.
art_movements.period_description: An artistic, literary, musical, and intellectual movement emphasizing emotion and individualism.

art_movements.name: Realism
art_movements.description: Unidealized depiction of everyday objects without embellishment.
art_movements.period_description: An artistic movement characterized by subjects painted from everyday life in a naturalistic manner.

art_movements.name: Impressionism
art_movements.description: Visible brushstrokes, emphasis on light effects, and vibrant colors that capture a momentary impression.
art_movements.period_description: A 19th-century art movement characterized by relatively small, thin, yet visible brush strokes, open composition, and emphasis on accurate depiction of light.

art_movements.name: Post-Impressionism
art_movements.description: Bold colors and thick brushstrokes, potentially distorting form for emotional effect.
art_movements.period_description: A predominantly French art movement that developed roughly between 1886 and 1905, extending Impressionism while rejecting its limitations.

art_movements.name: Art Nouveau
art_movements.description: Organic, flowing lines and nature-inspired forms.
art_movements.period_description: An international style of art, architecture, and applied art, characterized by highly-stylized, flowing, curvilinear designs often incorporating floral and other plant-inspired motifs.

art_movements.name: Fauvism
art_movements.description: Vivid, expressive use of color not tied to reality.
art_movements.period_description: The style of les Fauves (French for 'the wild beasts'), a group of early 20th-century modern artists whose works emphasized painterly qualities and strong color over representational values.

art_movements.name: Expressionism
art_movements.description: Distorted forms and colors to evoke emotional responses.
art_movements.period_description: A modernist movement originating in Germany at the beginning of the 20th century, focused on expressing emotion and subjective perspective.

art_movements.name: Cubism
art_movements.description: Fragmented into geometric shapes, shown from multiple angles simultaneously on a flat plane.
art_movements.period_description: An early-20th-century avant-garde art movement that revolutionized European painting and sculpture by depicting objects from multiple viewpoints.

art_movements.name: Futurism
art_movements.description: Dynamic, fragmented forms suggesting movement and technology.
art_movements.period_description: An artistic and social movement originating in Italy that emphasized speed, technology, youth, violence, and objects such as the car, the airplane, and the industrial city.

art_movements.name: Dada
art_movements.description: Provocative, absurdist approach, often using found objects or collage.
art_movements.period_description: An art movement of the European avant-garde in the early 20th century, rejecting logic and reason in favor of nonsense, irrationality, and intuition.

art_movements.name: Surrealism
art_movements.description: Realistic painting but in an impossible or dreamlike context that defies logic and reality.
art_movements.period_description: A cultural movement that began in the early 1920s, best known for its visual artworks and writings that aimed to release the creative potential of the unconscious mind.

art_movements.name: Abstract Expressionism
art_movements.description: Gestural brushstrokes and emotive use of color, with form often barely recognizable.
art_movements.period_description: A post-World War II art movement that developed in New York in the 1940s, characterized by spontaneous, automatic, or subconscious creation.

art_movements.name: Pop Art
art_movements.description: Flat, graphic style with bold colors, often incorporating elements of mass media or advertising.
art_movements.period_description: An art movement that emerged in the UK and the US during the mid- to late-1950s, challenging fine art traditions by including imagery from popular and mass culture.

art_movements.name: Minimalism
art_movements.description: Reduced to its most basic form, featuring simple shapes or monochromatic representations.
art_movements.period_description: A movement in visual arts, music, and other mediums beginning in post-World War II Western art, characterized by extreme simplicity of form and a literal, objective approach.

art_movements.name: Conceptual Art
art_movements.description: Focus on ideas over visual forms, often involving written descriptions or ephemeral installations.
art_movements.period_description: Art where the concept or idea behind the work is given more importance than the finished product, challenging traditional notions of art.

art_movements.name: Digital Art
art_movements.description: Encompasses various digital styles, from photorealistic 3D modeling to pixel art and glitch aesthetics.
art_movements.period_description: Art created or presented using digital technologies, becoming increasingly widespread with advancements in computer technology.
